works.name: I'm Everyone
works.description: A realtime, threaded, anonymous communication platform

works.name: Getting American Business Online
works.description: Googles US-wide programme to get all American businesses online, aiming to substantially reduce the count of all businesses in all US states that don't have websites.

works.name: Google Engage
works.description: Google's programme to extend the reach of its AdWords programme, spanning 33 countries.

works.name: Android Ambassador
works.description: Retail training for the worldwide launch of Android 4, Ice Cream Sandwhich

works.name: Simple OAuth2
works.description: A standalone, simple Python module that lets users authorize apps to use their Google, Twitter, Facebook etc. data

works.name: Fast REST
works.description: An easy to use, high level REST library that doesn't require boilerplate code, and takes advantage of Google App Engine's network infrastructure.

works.name: Training and Consulting
works.description: Linux training and consulting for Red Hat's Enterprise customers. I've trained a few hundred RHCEs and RHCAs. I'm the 'mikem' in the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 'sudoers' file!

works.name: User Privilege Revalidation Tools
works.description: Compliance tools to collect, summarize, data of thousands of servers and then revalidate the data with user's managers. Originally written for immediate need, the tools are still in use gfive years later.

works.name: Columnist, PC Authority Magazine
works.description: Monthly column in Australian/New Zealand computer magazine, circulation 55,000, on Linux, servers, 3G, content management, and other topics of interest to readers.

works.name: Feature Writer, APC Magazine
works.description: Regular pieces for the largest computer magazine in Asia Pacific, circulation 75,000.

works.name: Knife Party
works.description: A ticket sniper for EventBrite events

works.name: Python Docx
works.description: Create, read, and edit Microsoft Word OpenXML documents from pure Python. Presented at PyCon 2009.

works.name: Australian Linux Journal
works.description: Sourced writers, provided briefs, copy-edited, and interviewed for the first two issues of this Asia/Pacific magazine focusing on Linux and Open Source

works.name: Google Germany 10th Birthday
works.description: A visualization of Google Germany's history using HTML5 canvas.

works.name: Resilience
works.description: A tool to run and re-run tasks in cloud environments without performance guarantees. Allows developers to specify known exception scenarios, an acceptable amount of errors, backoffs, logging during these incidences, and proper crash reports for unexpected conditions.

works.name: World View
works.description: An app to collect questions from citiens all over the world, and addressed those questions to world leaders - including Barack Obama, Bono, David Cameron, Angela Merkel and Nicholas Sarkozy - in live YouTube interviews watched by millions of people.

works.name: TickTick Boom
works.description: An unoffical port ofTwitter for Mac to Chrome. Features include proactive notification of tweets, a direct message count in the chrome toolbar, and a recreation of the Twitter OS X multi-panel UI.
works.more: It also uses recent technologies including Chrome messaging, webkit filters, and Coffeescript behind the scenes. It's unfinished, but accomplished it's job of teaching the author how to make very large Chrome extensions.

works.name: URLSign
works.description: A short and simple tool to create signed URLs, so a browser redirected from site A to site B, site B know the information came from site A.

works.name: Sushi and Tears
works.description: A django tool that replaces the aging Unix gettext() system, requiring manual .po file uploads, with Google Spreadsheets, accessed via oauth

works.name: Software Development for Lawyers
works.description: A presentation for the Communications, Media, and Technology team from UK Law Firm Norton Rose. Topics convered include software development cycle, Open Source, and related matters.

works.name: The Path
works.description: One of the largest levels ever built for shooter Doom II, bypassing many of the contraints of the Doom engine including mechanical objects, deep water, timed events, and more.

works.name: Linux PocketBook 3rd Edition
works.description: Wrote over 40,000 words for this accessible and fun guide to Linux. Sold at a premium price (twenty Australian dollars), over 20,000 copies were sold.

works.name: Devil's Pie
works.description: A simple project to win a 'type-off' using the Ten Fast Fingers online typing test. At 4000 words per minute, it turns out I indeed have very fast fingers.

works.name: VentureCake
works.description: Sadly gone now, VentureCake was a technology blog concerning startups, virtualization, Linux, iPhone apps, and whatever else I felt like discussing. Around 70K visitors a day, with 60% of its articles hitting the frontpage of Digg, and traffic incoming from articles on The Register and Reuters.
